The Data & Insights (D&I) team is involved in every aspect of data at EA, using it to deliver valuable insights and solutions for game teams and players. We drive strategy, build data and AI tools, and support personalization, experimentation, and analytics. Join D&I to work with experts dedicated to improving understanding, workflows, and player experiences. The Role As an Analyst Intern on The Sims franchise, you'll work with massive volumes of player behavioral data to deliver insights and build models that inform game design, feature prioritization, and product development. You'll join a group of experienced analysts as a member of the embedded-and-dedicated analytics team and work closely with a large but tight-knit studio of enthusiastic industry craftspeople from all walks of life. This is a hybrid remote/in-office role based in Vancouver. You will report into a Senior Analyst. Responsibilities • Help the Maxis Analytics team understand and track key game performance metrics such as acquisition, engagement, retention and monetization. • Support our data team's strategy of building and productionalizing data products that improve the player experience. You will use your demonstrated experience building, validating and deploying predictive models and algorithms to address real-world problems. • Evaluate the impact of live service events, content updates and marketing campaigns. Establish benchmarks and provide projections during the planning phases; perform analysis to inform retrospectives; make recommendations for feature and content improvement. • Through data analysis, proactively find new opportunities to improve the player experience, improve acquisition, and drive incremental revenue. • Influence business decisions and product strategy through fact-based, data-driven insights and analysis; serve as a change agent in Maxis' transition to becoming a more data informed studio. Job Requirements Qualifications • Pursuing a bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Economics • Strong practical experience with SQL (able to write aggregations, joins, window functions) • Familiarity with at least one programming language for data analysis (e.g., Python, R) • Understanding of basic statistical concepts (probability, correlation, regression, classification) • Experience working with large datasets (coursework, research, or internships) • Experience with product analytics concepts (e.g., funnels, retention, engagement) is a plus • Experience with experiment design, execution, and interpretation is a plus • Experience with machine learning and other AI methodologies is a plus • Fan of The Sims™ is a plus You must be available for a full-time paid internship in the summer of 2026.
